entry.title: Providing shelter and education for the most vulnerable children in Armenia

media:group.media:title: Providing shelter and education for the most vulnerable children in Armenia
media:group.media:description:
The Fund for Armenian Relief Children‚Äôs Center has been providing assistance through crisis intervention and short-term rehabilitation to children who have been victims of abuse, abandonment and neglect. The team at the children‚Äôs center spoke to CivilNet about the center‚Äôs services, where the children come from, and how things have changed over the past 30 years.

media:group.media:description:

entry.title: UN officials attend Azerbaijan‚Äôs event in Shushi, Karabakh

media:group.media:title: UN officials attend Azerbaijan‚Äôs event in Shushi, Karabakh
media:group.media:description:
üìçNagorno-Karabakh‚Äôs Foreign Ministry condemns an event in Shushi marking 30 years of Azerbaijan‚Äôs membership in the UN. While the organization has no presence in Karabakh, its members participated in the event. üìçArmenian Defense Minister Suren Papikyan visits the border areas of the southern Syunik region. üìçArmenian Foreign Minister Ararat Mirzoyan holds talks with NATO Deputy Secretary General Mircea Geoana in Brussels.

entry.title: ‚ÄòInternational community should not abandon the Armenians of Nagorno-Karabakh‚Äô

media:group.media:title: ‚ÄòInternational community should not abandon the Armenians of Nagorno-Karabakh‚Äô
media:group.media:description:
Sossi Tatikyan, an international relations and security analyst, talks to CivilNet‚Äôs Emilio Cricchio about the recent security challenges in Nagorno-Karabakh. Tatikyan discusses the five-item ‚Äúproposal for peace‚Äù sent to Armenia by the Azerbaijani Foreign Ministry. She also comments on the ramifications of having almost no presence of international organizations in Nagorno-Karabakh.

entry.title: An architectural jewel in the heart of Yerevan

media:group.media:title: An architectural jewel in the heart of Yerevan
media:group.media:description:
The Hripsime School For Girls is a Tsarist-era building located in the heart of Yerevan. The building was constructed in the 19th century to educate Armenian women. It is a testimony to a city that was developing and modernizing. Unfortunately, it‚Äôs been 25 years since the school was abandoned and left in ruins.

media:group.media:title: Two Armenian soldiers have been found dead at their posts in the past two days
media:group.media:description:

entry.title: Portrait of Paradise, a photo book on Karabakh in times of peace and war

media:group.media:title: Portrait of Paradise, a photo book on Karabakh in times of peace and war
media:group.media:description:
Gilad Sade is an Israeli correspondent and a documentary photographer/filmmaker. He was present in Karabakh during the 2020 war with Azerbaijan. He is now publishing a book with his photos and notes about Karabakh in times of peace and war. The book‚Äôs name is Portrait of Paradise Lost.
He talks with CivilNet‚Äôs Ani Paitjan about his experience photographing people of Karabakh and the importance of making their voices heard.

entry.title: A New Wave of Russian Migrants in Armenia

media:group.media:title: A New Wave of Russian Migrants in Armenia
media:group.media:description:
Since the beginning of the Russian invasion of Ukraine, Armenia has seen a significant inflow of Russians into the country. They are seeking a safe haven from the Russian government‚Äôs new laws. However, many have found it difficult to find a place to stay and are facing a large rise in prices. CivilNet‚Äôs team spoke to some of the Russians in Yerevan to gain insight into their experience in Armenia thus far.
